result.execSummary:
The defendant Candiace Pulliam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Set at $16,483.77 JOINT & SEVERAL with any other persons convicted of these offenses payable to Medicaid Fraud Unit with the Wisc. Dept. of Justice.

Provide a DNA sample; pay the related surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable assessments, to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments including the restitution surcharge are to be collected by DOC up to 25% from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account. Non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription.
- Parties will be providing the Court with a Stipulation which will outline all the full victim's names that defendant is to have NO CONTACT with.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candiace Pulliam

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Assistant Attorney General Peter Tempelis with unsigned No Contact Order.  No Contact Order sent to Attorney Ehrfurth by Assistant Attorney General Peter Tempelis for defendant's signature.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $16,483.77 joint/several with any other persons convicted of these offenses, payable to Medicaid Fraud Unit with the Wisc. Department of Justice, to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable assessments, to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC up to 25% from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC up to 25%  from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Parties will be providing the Court with a Stipulation which will outline all the full victim's names that defendant is to have no contact with.  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription
-Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service
-Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
From Assistant Attorney General Peter Tempelis regarding possible new offenses
Email received from State requesting this matter be rescheduled for an earlier date than the currently scheduled date of December 16, 2016.
From Assistant Attorney General Peter Tempelis dated October 6, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions held in chambers.  Matter discussed on previous court date is still being investigated.  Court sets matter for sentencing, and will go forward.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Letter received from Whole Health Clinical Group, which outlines possible new offenses.  State wants bail revoked and defendant remanded.  Defense objects and requests bail remain the same.  Court places an oral no contact with the individual referenced in the letter dated September 1, 2016.  Court finds the allegations in the letter are just that, allegations.  State will be doing investigation into the new allegations.  Bail to remain the same.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2-9 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 1.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.  Payment of this surcharge will be addressed on the day of sentencing.  Bail to remain the same.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidebar conducted.  Parties are attempting to get defendant into Drug Treatment Court.  Parties request an adjournment.  Court grants one last adjournment.  If matter does not resolve on the next Court date, matter will be set for Jury Trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Timothy C Samuelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.   Matter set for a "soft" plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Timothy C Samuelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeffrey Becker-WI Department of Justice Medicaid Fraud Auditor.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
On defense motion, the Court accepts waiver of time limits as to the scheduling of the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Candiace Pulliam in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Candiace Pulliam in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl, Branch 19.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
